insights.marketShareMention: Identity becoming most critical layer of enterprise security
partnerships: Over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile, web applications and IT infrastructure vendors
insights.summary: Okta delivered solid Q2 performance with 13% total revenue growth driven by new business and existing customer expansion. The company maintained profitability while carefully managing expenses and continuing strategic investments in identity platform capabilities.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
Given the growth trends in cloud adoption and the movement to remote and hybrid workforces, identity has become the most reliable way to manage user access and protect digital assets

insights.summary: Okta delivered solid Q1 performance with 12% revenue growth, improving gross margins, and returning to profitability. The company demonstrated spend efficiency and continued focus on operational improvement while navigating macroeconomic challenges.
keyQuotes: Our ability to generate revenue is dependent upon our ability to maintain relationships with customers and increase their utilization of our platforms.
We continue to monitor the impacts of the economic situation; however, there can be no assurances that conditions in the banking sector and global financial markets will not worsen.

insights.marketShareMention: Over 19,450 customers across nearly every industry, with over 7,000 integrations as of October 31, 2024
insights.summary: Okta delivered solid quarterly performance with 14% revenue growth driven by increased users and product sales. The company maintained profitability, reduced operating expenses, and showed improving operational efficiency despite macroeconomic challenges.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
We focus on acquiring and retaining customers and increasing the value we provide over time

insights.marketShareMention: Over 19,300 customers across nearly every industry, with 4,620 customers having annual contract value above $100,000
partnerships: Over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile, web applications, IT infrastructure and security vendors
insights.summary: Okta demonstrated resilient performance in Q2, with 16% revenue growth and improved operational efficiency. The company continues to focus on cost management and maintaining customer retention, with a Dollar-Based Net Retention Rate of 110%.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
Future growth may be impacted by longer sales cycles
We expect sales and marketing expenses as a percentage of total revenue to decrease as our total revenue grows

insights.marketShareMention: Over 19,100 customers with 4,550 customers above $100,000 ACV
insights.summary: Okta showed moderate improvement in Q1 2024, with 19% revenue growth and continued focus on operational efficiency. The company maintained a cautious outlook amid macroeconomic challenges, implementing workforce reductions and managing expenses carefully.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
We expect our research and development expenses will increase in absolute dollars as our business grows
Larger enterprises often implement a limited initial deployment of our platform before increasing their deployment on a broader scale

partnerships: Over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile, web applications
insights.summary: Okta continues to grow revenue but faces challenges from cybersecurity incidents, macroeconomic uncertainty, and ongoing net losses. The company is focusing on identity management solutions and expanding its AI capabilities.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
We have experienced rapid growth, but customer growth has slowed in recent periods

insights.summary: Okta delivered 22% year-over-year subscription revenue growth, reaching $569 million in Q3. The company maintained cautious guidance amid macroeconomic challenges, reduced headcount through restructuring, and focused on improving operational efficiency.
keyQuotes: Given the growth trends in the number of applications and cloud adoption, and the movement to remote workforces, identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security.
Future growth may be impacted by longer sales cycles, which we have experienced, which in turn, could result in delays in deals closing.

insights.summary: Okta delivered 24% revenue growth driven by customer expansion, with 18,400 total customers and 4,205 customers with ACV over $100,000. The company is focused on cost efficiency and restructuring, with a cautious outlook amid macroeconomic uncertainty.
keyQuotes: Future growth may be impacted by longer sales cycles, which we have experienced, which in turn, could result in delays in deals closing
We expect to continue to incur operating losses and cash flows from operations that may fluctuate between positive and negative amounts for the foreseeable future

insights.marketShareMention: Over 17,050 customers across nearly every industry as of October 31, 2022
partnerships: Over 7,000 integrations with cloud, mobile and web applications and IT infrastructure and security vendors
insights.summary: Okta reported quarterly revenue of $481 million with a net loss of $208.9 million, continuing its growth trajectory in the identity management market while managing ongoing profitability challenges. The company maintains a cautious outlook amid macroeconomic uncertainties.
keyQuotes: Identity is becoming the most critical layer of an organization's security
We continue to see new interest from organizations driven by rapidly changing work and business environments
